summary: Ann Furnald Taylor was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) from 1977 to 1978. Her employment details, including her position and salary, are documented in several payroll certifications and related documents. These records cover various accounting periods throughout 1977 and 1978. A Final Determination Notification from the Assassination Records Review Board specifically mentions her payroll authorization forms, highlighting the postponement of Social Security number release to protect her personal privacy. She is also mentioned in a JFK Assassination System Identification Form, which includes background checks conducted on HSCA staff.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Ann Furnald Taylor's significance lies in her role as a staff member of the HSCA, contributing to the investigation of the JFK assassination. The documentation of her employment provides insight into the operational aspects of the committee and the measures taken to protect the privacy of its staff.
